Articles.Content:
Nk-33 shouldn't be missing a texture. unless you didn't remove the old files before the new ones.

anyway two competeing shapes for the next engine. you have the current shape on the left (green) the next one to the right which is the new design for the same engine that the russians will be making AKA better. also green. followed by Nk-33 Chmaber and Rd-0146 chamber. Which is better of the two green ones?

Left, I'd say. Cones are inefficient.

/realism.

Left, I'd say. Cones are inefficient.

/realism.

clones? the darker green one is the newest version of the engine. the light green is like the 1960's version lol.
So, CBBP, are you going to make th whole pack before releasing it, or are we going to get something soontm? I'd really like to have that URM.

Nk-33 shouldn't be missing a texture. unless you didn't remove the old files before the new ones.

Huh, ill re-download the pack from Spaceport again, this is the first time I have installed KOSMOS since 0.16 or something so no prior install. Guess my zip got Spaceport'd and corrupted the textures or something. Will report back when I have a fresh download done.

Edit: Can we get a Mediafire mirror for the pack by any chance? Spaceport is awful and keeps cutting downloads after only downloading 15MB of the file, this is after it downloads at 10KB/s due to running all Spaceport downloads off one server with less than good bandwidth. (Give us Steam Workshop please Squad, please...)

Edited September 25, 2013 by Zaran

It is all ready to roll aside form waiting for Normak to add the descriptions lol. he disappeared. giving him another week I suppose. If not NMB will have the task while we wait for Normaks return.

I'll help with the descriptions: "This part is cool" Copy / paste through the config files. Done.

Really, there's no point in waiting. Tell NMB to write descriptions or something. The community really wants this pack.

clones? the darker green one is the newest version of the engine. the light green is like the 1960's version lol.

Cones, not clones. I prefer the darker green one, it should actually be more efficient.

The difference in efficiency between a cone and a bell nozzle is about 1%, there could easily be some dynamic or other which made them opt for a cone design over a more complex shape.

Also, check out the NK33 mockup here:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nozzle_extension

Ah so I take it that my NK-33 missing it's texture is a known issue to do with the new texture format you are using CBBP?

I am using the NK33 on my Antares clone, with a Advanced SRB from that variable stack-able SRB mod on top it makes a rather good Antares!

Do elaborate about this antares clone, I'd like to see it.

I've found an interesting drawing of N1 and it's competitors: http://www.fas.org/irp/imint/94vol47_vick.htm

You could find this interesting.
if cone is inefficent why does the Dark green one resemble J-2X so much lol
pretty sweet pics form Jack Wolfe

Got some technical difficulties worked out and did some lag testing. I noticed a lot (and I mean a LOT) of wobble on the provided TKS with URM lifter (and this was with stock SAS, not mechjeb). Simply converting 75% of the textures to .tga like you did helped the lag out quite a bit. With some resizing, I'll be able to stream lag free this weekend. I want to get the station framework assembled first. I also am debating which module type would look better up there. FusTek expansion or KOSMOS. For sake of product placement, I'll be using several KOSMOS modules and might even do a Mir replica on stream.
Make sure to put it on de youtubez when your done, I'd like to watch it, but I'm busy most of the day with school.

Captain Sierra the wobble is because you need to turn off all but 2 main engine gimbals before launch. the engines are so powerful they place to much power back and forth

as for nozzle the blue is the Buran style and the green is the Block D style. still a mystery as to which to choose. the buans style ha sbetter stats than the block D one lol
Huh, I stand corrected. Never mind.

So i amended the shape of the RD-0146 nozzle because it was not at the ideal curve so now it is.... and while doing it I made an un extending version for landers and such... refer to Jack Wolfe's issue with using them for landers.

Do elaborate about this antares clone, I'd like to see it.

It's nothing special, and I am waiting for the half size Advanced SRB's to be released before I go back to trying to work on this but here are a few screenshots. When I say Antares Clone I mean, take two NK33's, stick em on the bottom of a tank and use a SRB upper stage.

Taking the NK-33's out for a stroll...

Let's go to the Mun while we're up here...

The new RD-0146 is a perfect fit!

pretty sweet pics form Jack Wolfe

Looks good.

So are are the modular landing tanks coming back?

Looks good.

So are are the modular landing tanks coming back?

no reason you cannot stack URm tanks as is. but eventually yes. Lk should return. but in some months lol
well it would have been out today but... we got an MIA

well it would have been out today but... we got an MIA

Wat? NOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!

My TKSL Project is getting delayed :C!

(Maybe for few days more...)

well it would have been out today but... we got an MIA

So I'll be sitting here over the weekend refreshing this thread, in between random rocket launches and family activities, in other words.
Good news it is up.
